intro: Aylostera tarijensis, commonly known as the Tarijensis aylostera, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Bolivia and Peru. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or arid regions. Aylostera tarijensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has limited use in traditional medicine.
